Welcome to my little Fashion Hub

I am Jane! A fashion enthusiast, photographer and blogger. I also do product reviews. Come inside!

Hi, I am Jane Donshon

I am a traveller, fashion blogger, and amateur photographer. This is my personal site, and a summary of what I am working on this period. Get in touch! More about me

Working with top Fashion Influencers

I am a traveller, fashion blogger, and amateur photographer. This is my personal site, and a summary of what I am working on this period. Get in touch! The emergence and growth of blogs in the late 1990s coincided with the advent of web publishing tools that facilitated the posting of content by non-technical users who did not have much experience with HTML or computer programming.

Shop my Style

As a fashion influencer, I collaborate with many brands and celebrities Learn More

Collaborations

item.title: About me
item.dc:creator: johnfraskos
item.content:encoded:
About me

I am a fashion photographer and blogger, feel free to read the whole story. Whereas a trend often connotes a very specific aesthetic expression, and often lasting shorter than a season.

Connect on social

Facebook Twitter Google-plus Pinterest Instagram Fashion is a popular aesthetic expression in a certain time and context, especially in clothing, footwear, lifestyle, accessories, makeup, hairstyle and body proportions.[1] Whereas a trend often connotes a very specific aesthetic expression, and often lasting shorter than a season, fashion is a distinctive and industry-supported expression traditionally tied to the fashion season and collections. Style is an expression that lasts over many seasons, and is often connected to cultural movements and social markers, symbols, class and culture (ex. Baroque, Rococo, etc).  section overline

My Services

Product review

Click edit button to change this text. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.

Photography

Click edit button to change this text. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.

Writing

Click edit button to change this text. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet. like what you see?

Follow on Instagram

★★★★★ 5/5 Working out in this Gym has been one of the best decisions I have ever made for my fitness. Really love the positive vibes and friendly atmosphere. Evelyn Thompson Facebook-f Twitter Google-plus-g Linkedin-in

item.title: Shop my style
item.dc:creator: johnfraskos
item.content:encoded:
Shop my Style

Get inspired by my style and the trends I follow in fashion, and find direct product links! I constantly refine my fashion style and keep myself updated with latest trends. Here is where I review products that I love, and I hope you will love them too!

Red Velvet Dress

Post-ironic tumeric shoreditch, raw denim photo booth chambray tofu.

Review Details

Zinben Sunglasses

Pabst edison bulb echo park lyft subway tile schlitz glossier yuccie austin banh.

Review Details

Moonor Shoes

Umami intelligentsia lo-fi trust fund typewriter neutra meditation man braid.

Review Details

Katte Love Lipstick

Umami intelligentsia lo-fi trust fund typewriter neutra meditation man braid.

Review Details

Flamingo bag

Post-ironic tumeric shoreditch, raw denim photo booth chambray tofu.

Review Details

Littal Hydraskin

Pabst edison bulb echo park lyft subway tile schlitz glossier yuccie austin banh.

Review Details

Sign up to newsletter!

Sign up to my mailing list and get notified every time a new style gets published

Connect on social

Facebook Twitter Google-plus Pinterest Instagram

YouTube Channel

Become a subscriber, get fresh videos every week.

Instagram

The best way to stay connected with me is through my insta-feed.

Newsletter

Sign up for email updates and get the best tips and deals

item.title: Product review

item.content:encoded:
Flamingo Bag

One of my favorite products is this stylish bag from Pink Flamingo. Comes in a beautiful pink color, original leather and super comfy Buy from Amazon

9.5/10

Rating
★★★★★ 5/5 “...One of my favorite products is this stylish bag from Pink Flamingo. Comes in a beautiful pink color, original leather and super comfy...” EVELYN THOMPSON overline

Why I love this

Cloud bread flannel poke, flexitarian vinyl iPhone church-key shaman williamsburg kitsch beard.  Kale chips knausgaard mustache blog fashion axe selfies salvia. 

Comfort Style quality Facebook-f Twitter Google-plus-g Linkedin-in section overline

More favorites

Red Velvet Dress

Post-ironic tumeric shoreditch, raw denim photo booth chambray tofu.

Pabst edison bulb echo park lyft subway tile schlitz glossier yuccie austin banh.

item.title: Get in touch
item.dc:creator: johnfraskos
item.content:encoded:
Get in touch

Whereas a trend often connotes a very specific aesthetic expression, and often lasting shorter than a season, fashion is a distinctive and industry-supported expression.

Follow me on Social, stay connected!

I am a fashion photographer and blogger, feel free to read the whole story.

Connect on social

Facebook Twitter Google-plus Pinterest Instagram If you wish to book one of my services, or start a collaboration, please send an email to hello[at]nevefashion.com

Send me a direct message using this form

like what you see?

Follow on Instagram

item.title: Blog
item.dc:creator: johnfraskos

item.title: Colorism in fashion
item.dc:creator: mihaighenciu
item.content:encoded:
Since the 1970’s, fashion models of color, especially black men and women, have experienced an increase in discrimination in the fashion industry.

In the years from 1970 to 1990, black designers and models were very successful, but as the 1990’s came to an end, the fashion aesthetic changed and it did not include black models or designers.

In today’s fashion, black models, influencers, and designers account for one of the smallest percentages of the industry. There are many theories about this lack of diversity, that it can be attributed to the economic differences usually associated with race and class, or it can reflect the differences in arts schooling given to mostly black populated schools, and also blatant racism.

item.title: The notion of global fashion industry
item.dc:creator: johnfraskos
item.content:encoded:
The notion of global fashion industry is a product of the modern age. Prior to the mid-19th century, most clothing was custom-made. It was handmade for individuals, either as home production or on order from dressmakers and tailors. By the beginning of the 20th century—with the rise of new technologies such as the sewing machine, the rise of global capitalism and the development of the factory system of production, and the proliferation of retail outlets such as department stores—clothing had increasingly come to be mass-produced in standard sizes and sold at fixed prices.

Although the fashion industry developed first in Europe and America, as of 2017, it is an international and highly globalized industry, with clothing often designed in one country, manufactured in another, and sold worldwide. For example, an American fashion company might source fabric in China and have the clothes manufactured in Vietnam, finished in Italy, and shipped to a warehouse in the United States for distribution to retail outlets internationally. The fashion industry has long been one of the largest employers in the United States, and it remains so in the 21st century. However, U.S. employment declined considerably as production increasingly moved overseas, especially to China.

Because data on the fashion industry typically are reported for national economies and expressed in terms of the industry's many separate sectors, aggregate figures for world production of textiles and clothing are difficult to obtain. However, by any measure, the clothing industry accounts for a significant share of world economic output. The fashion industry consists of four levels: the production of raw materials, principally fibers and textiles but also leather and fur. the production of fashion goods by designers, manufacturers, contractors, and others. retail sales various forms of advertising and promotion These levels consist of many separate but interdependent sectors.

These sectors are Textile Design and Production, Fashion Design and Manufacturing, Fashion Retailing, Marketing and Merchandising, Fashion Shows, and Media and Marketing. Each sector is devoted to the goal of satisfying consumer demand for apparel under conditions that enable participants in the industry to operate at a profit.
